availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Graves County Court } ss
Called Term
March 21st 1862
At called term of Graves County Court as aforesaid present and presiding W. W Robertson Judge the following order was made (Viz)

"It is hereby ordered to be certified to his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of this Commonwealth that from and after this date, the Office of Presiding Judge of this Court will be & is hereby Vacated, by the resignation of the Judge hereof.

It is further ordered that the Clerk of this Court by Summons, Convene the Justices of the peace for this County at the Court House on the 5th day of April next, to select a person to fill the Vacancy thus Occasioned."
Attest James M. Coulter C. G. C. C.
